medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic, recurrent familial benign pemphigus (Hailey-Hailey disease)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented with a 4-year history of HHD involving the axillary and inguinal regions. Patient 2 had a 24-year history of HHD affecting the inguinal and vulvar areas accompanied by mucosal erosions. Symptoms included chronic pain and pruritus, leading to significant discomfort and interference with daily activities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients have a history of Hailey-Hailey disease with previous treatments including topical and oral corticosteroids, antibiotics, and dermabrasion. Patient 2 also had a history of unemployment due to chronic pain.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 2 has a family history of HHD; her mother and grandmother were affected. Patient 1 has no family history of HHD.
medical_history.social_history: Patient 2 reported social retirement due to her chronic pain and pruritus. No other social history was specified.
